titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to William Stewart
CWG13782

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1864 Clothing, Camp & Garrison Equipage, Telegraph Expenses, Some Claim Letters; Bundle 1

body.p:
No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To William Stewart, Dr.

row.cell: To Services rendered in assisting the organization of the Enrolled Militia.

body.p: Approved. And the Q. M. Genl is ordered to pay Same out of the Militia fund.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

D W Lindsey
Inspector Quarter-Master Gen. Ky.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 30th of July, 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-master General of Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Eighty Three Dollars and Thirty Three Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
No. Abstract B Qr. 186.
D. W. Lindsey
Dollars 225. 00/100
Paid July 30, 1864.

No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To William Stewart, Dr.

row.cell: To. Services rendered in assisting the organization of the Enrolled Militia.

body.p: Approved. And the Q. M. Genl is ordered to pay Same out of the militia fund.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

D W Lindsey
Inspector Quarter-Master Gen. Ky.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 30th of July, 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-master General of Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Eighty Three Dollars and thirty three Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
No. Abstract B Qr. 186.
Wm Stewart
Dollars 83. 33/100
Paid July 30th, 1864.
